reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR

-Not the most difficult survival game on the market, but still has challenges that you would expect.
-A great place to start for somebody who's never played a survival game (difficulty level is similar to minecraft) but I don't think you even have to eat that often.
-Crafting feels deep, entertaining and rewarding.  It can be a grind at times, but that goes hand in hand with a survival/crafting game.
-Combat isn't super challenging, also comparable to minecraft.  Just have to size up your opponent, and then kite.  Fun though, oddly addicting because of watching your loot drop.
-Worth the price, in my opinion, I would say the bugs are minor, and very easy to ignore... In fact, I haven't found many bugs myself.
-Only real downside I can think of is how many Misty Areas" there are in the world (which is huge!  Takes a long time to travel accross it) but there are a lot of inhabitable areas labeled as "Misty Areas" where it's rediculously foggy... this kinda.. well

This game is great!  My wife and I play together and we love it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Leveling your skills takes allot of time.
-Traveling around the map and meeting new people is quite fun and amusing at times.
-You can build a base and secure it pretty easly as you do not need a gate, You can parkour your way into your base but others can not jump into your base over the walls. This removes the lockpickers ability to get into your base.
-You have access to ground mounts only(Ranching level 20). seems about 50% to 60% speed boost.
-Fishing is an easy way to always have food. as you need to eat quite frequently.
-The crafting system is pretty fun, sometimes rare items drop, blue >purple>Orange which enable you to craft stronger versions of regular items such as weapons and armour.
-PvP is not yet very developed. you are always quite safe because if anyone Attacks you they will turn yellow with a debuff and be attacked by any tower nearby, so all you have to do is run to a nearby base and you are safe.
-PVP debuffs are Yellow which only lasts a munite then you are back to blue(nutral)., Red which can last hours and you lose allot of items if you die. and Pink, which is a a red criminal with a bounty on them. You can see them on the map.

This has been an intresting game. and If you like building and exploring you will probably enjoy it allot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:

-FRIENDLY:
The mechanics are easy.
The deaths do not really punish players (as long as they are not criminals).
Community is not bad at all. Ofc there are ***holes as they are everywhere, but i've found friendly players mostly.
-PLAYER BASE: Decent, the world is big but you are always meeting new players.
-EXPLORING: Big map with different biomes to explore each with characteristic resources and creatures.
-DEVS: They do listen & update!

Cons:

-EARLY ACCESS: Expected bugs.
-GRINDY: Sometimes it feels like woodcutting simulator.
-SOLO PLAYERS: Will definetly have a bad time. This game is about making communities. You cannot be a master in every skill.
-PLAYER ABUSE: Biggest issue so far imo. New players have it really hard to begin if they get harrassed/robbed/destroyed by stronger players.
-MAP: Not finished. It has some misty zones that are annoying.
-TIME CONSUMING.

Overall, great Survival RPG which is MUCH more enjoyable when playing with friends.

For those concerned about the negative reviews, most of them are from people playing alone who have been robbed.
Unlike other games of this genre there's at least a criminal system, which is not perfect, but it is better than nothing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Highly recommended!
I'm not much of a gamer.  When I do play games, I usually gravitate toward the easier and more relaxing games.  My favorite games are games like The Sims, Harvest Moon, and Animal Crossing.
In this game you are a survivor from a ship wreck.  You play online with other survivors, all trying to make a new life on the island.  The game involves a lot of harvesting and searching for items, and then crafting buildings and defenses to help your new village survive against mobs and other survivors.
The game is still in early access, so keep that in mind; but it is definitely worth purchasing, even in its early form.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start by saying that this game can be a lot of fun.

That being said I have a few issues with it...

1. Since it is a persistant, always active world, when you log out for the night then log in the next day theres a good chance everything you've built will be destroyed.

2. Building on 1, this game needs private servers or a single player version of the game. It took me hours to get a decent base of operations set up and over night it was all gone.

3. This one is minor compared to the others but the day/night cycle should be closer to 70%/30% not 50%/50%. When it's night time you can't even see your own character.

I enjoy just about everything else that this game is doing and since its still in early access I'm hoping they make some of these changes. As of the current state of the game I can only recommend this game to the kinds of people that like ruining other peoples fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Keeping in mind that this game is in Early Access (which means it's NOT complete), I'd say this is a game worth a recommendation.

If this isn't even a complete game, what the hell am I giving a recommendation based on??

1. Landscape and environment design and distribution.

2. Logic of progression and interrelation between skills.

3. Combat system's basic foundation (equipment, durability, no potion spam, stats, hunger and stamina)

4. OddOne Team's FUTURE Goals, Plans, and evident capability of adjusting course.

I'd write a long review but that doesn't seem to work out. So keeping it short, everything is cohesive and interrelated. No one can do everything and there are reasons to specialize, socialize, and fight, both PvP and PvE. Also has adequate potential penalties for reckless PvP now, though it still needs more work.

Overall, quite enjoyable and will hopefully just get better.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can't really recommend this game as-is. There's a lot of interesting things in it but far more needs to be improved.

Starting with some interesting stuff:

Your character gains levels in one of several skills by accomplishing tasks. Logging skill is gained by chopping trees, tailoring skill by sewing, etc. This system allows you to specialize in a few areas so your guildmates can have easily defined tasks and work together better. There's a limit to how many levels you can earn in total, but you can lock out a skill from gaining levels so you're not wasting any in an area you don't plan to use.

The characters and landscape are cute and brightly colored. Character creation is limited to hair, skin color, face and eyes, but character models can still look fairly different if you try hard enough.

There is a sense of accomplishment when you go from one tier of a skill to the next, unlocking different things to craft. It makes you feel like you're making progress, even if you're not decked out in the best gear in the world.

Why I can't recommend it:

The skill system is definitely meant for multiplayer, which creates a glaring problem: Each character has to start out somewhere, and at this stage, that somewhere is rarely with a group of people who've chosen different specializations. For the higher tier items and buildings, you need to reach out to other skills for certain ingredients. Most people will start out solo, testing the waters before they get into a guild. The game needs to account for that, possibly with a tutorial level or time period before specialization is implemented.

The hunger system is a nuisance at best. At least in the early stages, there doesn't seem to be an option to slow or halt the speed at which a character loses hunger points. The amount of points you get from certain edible items also don't make sense. An apple gives 50 points; a cooked apple only gives something around 27, but a cooked maggot gives 80? Going hungry slows you down and stops your hp regen, which is fair, but it happens so often during a single day/night cycle that it almost forces you to specialize in cooking to keep up.

The guild system also needs a lot of work. I personally experienced an issue when I joined a guild with two other members. We were working together to build a base and put guild locks on all of our houses/shelters. Then, out of nowhere, the two guildmates decided to delete their characters. That immediately disbanded the guild, which also left me unable to access the other buildings with guild locks.

Starter objects such as campfires and workbenches are scattered everywhere from newbies who gave the game a try for a few hours. That makes the landscape look far more populous than it is. I played on the American server and probably only ran into a few people at a time, and only one that looked like they invested some time in the game.

Ultimately, this is a rough gemstone that needs a lot of polish. It has potential and it killed a few hours while I was ill, but there are far better Early Access survival games out there for your money.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: Now there are apparently hackers running throughout the entire map on North American server, wiping everyone and everything out and stealing everything they can get their hands on. Lovely!

I had previously submitted suggestions regarding mounts, and the flute system. Now I'm having a new issue. Every single saddle I try to tame a bred bull with, even though it had a cowbell on it, slips off.

I spent a whole real day gathering materials for almost 10 saddles, and every single one slipped off. A week or so ago, when I first tamed a bull that I had captured, the saddle worked on the first try. Even then, I had an issue with the flute and its 8 uses being not enough. Now I'm spending more than 50% of my game-time, grinding to make saddles that don't even work. I'm level 34 ranching for Christ's sake. This should not be happening.

This basically forces users to purchase the Wild Zaka if they ever want to use a mount. It's absurd. I am writing a negative review on this game and halting game play permanently until this is resolved. The game isn't fun anymore. It's pointless. I have almost 120 hours on my account and most of those were getting materials and skills needed to make saddles, only to find out that now they're almost useless.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

HOW TO HAVE A GOOD EXPERIENCE IN TOL:

1) Join a guild
---------------

Go to the forums, here on Steam or the official one, and find a guild that matches your playstyle. While it's true that you can play this game solo, it's going to be incredibly hard and frustrating. At the core, the game is not designed for you to do everything on your own; you'll notice this by the vast amount of skills available, and only a few that you can master. You'll need to rely on others to access higher level craftings, just as they will need to rely on you based on your own expertise. If you decide to go the solo way, you'll only be able to access mediocre level crafts be it for defense or offence,

A community (guild) provides a lot of things:

_ Safer environment: if you have a reputable guild, almost no one will attack you, and your base and belonging will be very safe.
_ Play your way: due to the safe nature of your environment, you are free to play the way you want, hardcore, pvp, pve, or very casualy.
_ Mentoring: like many have said, the learning curve for a new player can be very daunting, joining a guild of experienced players can smooth that a lot. We teach and provide guidance to all our members old or new.
_ Skill sharing: as I said in the beginning, you wan't master all the skills yourself, but in a guild you can have a master in each skill willing to offer his/her competences. So everybody benefits.
_ Starting Gear: most guids will provide the new members with full sets of gear, and virtually unlimited food access. That alone will jumpstart the game experience for many new players.
_ Friends: last but not least, being part of a community will bring you many new friends who will enhance your game experience.


2) Be Creative
---------------

This is very important, it's a lot more to what people would call a sandbox game. Here you create your own goals and objectives, there are no set quests to do or anything forcing you in any direction. You decide how you want to play the game.

Here are some common starter goals:

_ Maxing out skill points: get specialize in 8 skills (all level 50), that alone will take you a lot of time.
_ Build a formidable base: does this ever ends?
_ Get the best gear possible: find the best materials, craft them with the best skills.
_ Survive the highest level of Monster Invasion: Your base will be raided by monsters in epic events, can you survive?

Here are some more diverse goals:

_ Visit the entire map.
_ Help new players.
_ Shape the world (my favorite, I spend most of my time, crafting roadways, doing landscaping making our surrounding beautiful and practical)
_ Become a traveling merchant. Lots of players like to do that, especially more solo oriented players.
_ Open trading/crafting zone for all.
_ etc...

Really it's all up to you, the main point I'm trying to make is that maxing out your skills isn't the endgame here, just a part of the game to allow you to do even more.


3) OOG is a small company
----------------------------

Not trying to be an excuse for them, but once you acknowledge the fact that the devs are a small group, and the game has and will have some bugs and glitches, that things take time to be developped, you'll get a lot less frustrated when a problem occurs.

Tree of Life has so much to offer in terms of fun that it would too bad to spoiled that enjoyment by focusing on the little things that weight it down.


4)  Debunking Major Complains
---------------------------------

_ ToL is P2W (Pay To Win): No, just no. people have been complaining about the cash shop items as being P2W. The store provides a mount that allows you to travel faster; well be informed that anyone can also have a mount in game for free, relatively easily. The store provides a bag with 14 slots storage capacity; here again not P2W at all, I can and do craft in game 15 slots bags to my fellow guildmembers, that is more storage and for free. If I have a complain about the cash shop, it's not that it's P2W, but rather too limited in choices, and the prices too high in my opinion. People who buy from the store do that mostly to support the game developers.

_ ToL is not for casual players: Wrong, get a good guild and you'll play as casualy as you want. Some of us just like to log in to chat or farm a few plots of land only.

_ In ToL PVP is everywhere: Like all games there are Dbags, but in all truth, most of the PVP can be avoided easily. In 550 hours of gameplay, I got killed only once, and mostly because I let the other player do it. Being part of a good guild will ensure that you are not randomly attacked, and that if you are, retribution will come.


ANNEXE: MY CURRENT ISSUES

_ Communication with the devs is still a big issue, both due to the fact that replies are rare and limited, as well as the language barrier. Alice is trying her best, but then again there's just so much one can do.

_ Support virtually inexistant. If you have  a problem and report it, it will most likely fall in deaf ears... they won't even bother acknowledging your problem, they just won't reply at all. (most of the time)

_ Memory Leak, the game is far from being fully optimize and regular memory leaks force you to reboot the game after a few hours online or the game will lag to hell or crash by itself.

_ Game mechanics, yes there's some finetuning to do here, but I won't complain too much since they are patching albeit slowly, regularly. Just need to be patient here.


CONCLUSION

With over 500 hours (and many more to come), I have more than my money worth in this game. I have a great time when I'm online, and got to make great friends too with who I can enjoy this game and others!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe initial learning curve is steep. WIth no intro tutorial you are left to try and figure things out. Playing with friends is a must and make sure you log in often because the hard work you spent will decay over time. Night-time is LONG and pitch black. The cartoony style hides the fact that this game is difficult and hard to like. Trolls and Greifers prey on newbies. I get the impression that if this game ever gets out of beta microtransactions will creep into it. However like other games I feel this will probably be abandoned by developers within the year because interest will fall off.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tree of Life is very much about just that. Trees. Everything you do revolves around trees. Every profession requires trees. You and your friends will spend about 75% of your time cutting down trees, cutting logs, harvesting firewood and crafting things from that firewood. Burning the firewood (for charcoal). Refining the firewood for building materials. And on and on and on.

Now, the game overall has huge, almost Minecraft-like, potential. Early access is exactly that, early access. I make no assumption about how the game will develop or its end goals. But, I can't recommend a game where the 3 quarters of my first 30 hours of my gameplay were spent chopping and harvesting trees. Between the animations, travel times, harvesting time and refining time, the end product was bittersweet. Great me and my 2-5 man guild built a defense tower. Only 10 more to go. Just finished a length of wood wall for our castle. Great, only 3 more to go.

A good rebuke would be to find a larger guild more active guild. As is common with the survival genre. However, even then, I have a gut feeling that my played-time would still be mostly chopping wood.

Aside from the crafting woes, which lets be serious this game is all about, combat is still rough. Bunny hopping, circling strafing is rampant. Weapons (which all require wood to craft) are simplistic. Nothing really gave me a wow moment. Magic is not in the game at the time of this post. But, I'll make the jump that it will be OP, especially if there is no-miss chances and proximity issues, as there is with melee combat.

Recommendation right now is to wait, maybe a month or year. Never can tell with the early-access buys.

Good luck,

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't know how many hours I've played this game.  Not very many, but every so often I have another go.  To be fair, it's rubbish.  One of the silliest bits is the day/night cycle.  During the 'night' you can't really do anything, so close on half the time in the game is lost while you sit in total darkness.  You can light a torch, but that doesn't shorten the 'night'.

Then the help system is diabolical.  As with many other games, all the help is provided by users posting individual documents. That's OK, and I applaud their efforts, but it is not organised in any way and I find it almost impossible to find the help I need.  At least, within a reasonable time.

If  you can put up with all that, then you will be frequently 'killed' by the various monsters.  You can then turn into a 'ghost' and wait for long minutes to return to life.  You can shorten this wait by finding Soul Pieces, but that doesn't reduce the time-wasting.

This is not a game that you can play, either for the odd half-an-hour of spare time you have  or for a whole evening, and come away with a sense of satisfaction.  I feel more like throwing the PC through the window, which would be rather expensive.  Mind you, I don't dare calculate what I've spent on PC and Mac games that, like this one, just aren't really very good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game will consume a whole afternoon and night, because there's just so much you can do to improve your character's skills and your base, along with exploration and the discovery of the game's core mechanics. Now, combine that with friends and the fun is multiplied.

It is really fun and has a quite interesting concept, but there is one undeniable truth that must not be overlooked: it is an early access game. However, by this I don't mean it's buggy (we actually had a bug-free long session of play), what I do mean is that it's still terribly unbalanced in the whole PVP/Crime system. In brief, if you pretend to play as a responsable, moral player, it's gonna be great while you're actually in-game (since people are pretty nice and conversative), but the second you stop playing, there is a 90% chance the next time you log in, you will find your nice, little settlement burned, destroyed and viciously raided. And there is nothing you can do to prevent this; you can protect your base against monsters (which is kind of weak, since the auto-turrets" do so little damage and cost so much)
date: but not against players. Players can destroy everything you built and nothing happens to them.\n\nThe system punishes your "crimes"
recommended: which are killing players who are not red and lockpicking other player's stashes. The punishment is making you a red player (red players drop everything when killed). But what happens to destroying another players property or trespassing? Stealing crops and killing my livestock animals is not considered a crime
hoursPlayed: so everyone can do it the second my crops and animals enter their vision. If you try to defend your stuff against a non-red player
voteText: and eventually kill him

votesTotal: unless you really want to kill them and turn red. If you decide to kill them and turn red
votesFunny: they will spawn back and kill you
commentsCount: taking all the stuff you are carrying
column16: and they won't turn red because they are killing a "criminal".\n\nThis is the only thing that truly prevents me from reviewing this game as positive
column17: since I find this is a joy-killing broken feature. I do not mind a PVP world
column18: as long as I can actually do something to protect what's mine.\n\nI do hope developers come out with some way to balance this broken system so I can go back and enjoy this evolving world. Only then I will change this review."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've only played for a couple of hours so far, but i can already say, that this game has a lot of potential. It has it's problems, don't get me wrong, but the core elements of the game are already fantastic.

In this game you have to practise your skills in order to level them up (i.e. you chop wood to raise your logging level, or you craft some tools to raise tinkering). You start with the basics and craft a working bench, but later, if your skill levels are high enough you will be able to build houses, walls, watchtowers and everything else you need for your little town/fortress.

The map is huge! And the best part about it: You actually have to explore more and more of it, because of the constant need of better material.

Fighting in this game can be quite a hassle, because of the weird camera angle and somewhat random hitboxes, but i think it's manageable. There are quite a few different kind of weapons to choose from, and you level your weapon skill by using the weapon of your choice.

As stated above, you get better at skills by using them, but they also give you statpoints, based on how high your current skilllevel is. So in the long run your character gets stronger and stronger just like in other MMORPGs.

Tree of Life also features some sort of morality system, where you get flagged as a criminal for doing naughty things like murdering and stealing. The more people you kill, the longer you get to be a criminal, and as a criminal you lose everything upon death. I do hope, that they tweak this system a bit, because defending yourself against a non-criminal nets you some sweet criminal time, if you manage to kill your attacker.


TL:DR: It's a solid Early Access game with minor and fixable flaws and if you have some friends, who like these kind of games, i recommend you to get a 4-pack and start having some fun.

Edit:
Since the new patch as of today (18.06.2015) i can't recommend the game anymore.
The changes made to gear durability and the crime system are really really ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As much as I would like to recommend this game, I simply can't.

While the game itself is really good, recent changes and the lack of action from the developers against exploiters have left me, and many others like me, wondering why we should bother to play.

A recent duplication bug allowed many players to speed level masteries, create countless top level items, nearly unlimited amounts of gold and build massive bases with the best defences possible. The only thing that was removed by the developers was the gold, everything else remains in the game. Even the players were not banned, even though the developers claimed that exploiters would be.

So I ask you this, why bother trying to level up your masteries and build your base legitimately when so many cheated their way to the top? Why bother trying to collect rare resources to craft the top gear when you will never be able to honestly collect the amounts the cheaters have saved in stores?

Maybe, and that is a big maybe, it will be worth trying this game if they wipe everything and restart. Until then don't waste your money.

After playing for 3 weeks, there is nothing to do.  Patch changes make the game much worse, in that crafting things is pointless due to durability losses of weapons and armor.  This game needs tons of dungeons and several PvP mechanics to be worthwhile.  I don't foresee them adding any decent content like that for probably a year as they are a small dev team.

PvP is very lacking and I doubt they will be able to add a different system, as it is already laggy with slow response times on actions.  Stay away until there is already in-game (not in-theory or in-planning) much, much more content.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really enjoyed the game until the last patch.

They cheanged weapon and armor durability so that weapons and armor break rediculously fast. You can easily break a top-tier weapon weapon in an hour, and these weapons take a lot of materials to create. Armor wears out fast too and is also very time consuming to make.

The devs gave a wishy-washy answer as to if they are going to correct this.

They also radically changed PvP rules.

The above dramatically impacted the player population and now it is hard to even find another player online.

The devs also have an issue balencing material collection efficency. They nerfed the ways trees drop samplings so that deforestation will be an ever bigger problem then before. There were whole tracks of barren land where all the trees were cut down. This means no wood and wood is central to all building and crafting.

I get the impression the devs want us to spend hours gatehring enough wood to build just a few things; this is a typical Asian MMO mindset. It also seems like the devs have not learned the lessons that other MMOs have delt with over the past 15 years or so (eg.g Griefing, duping, Skill loss, grinding tredmills, no fast travel, etc.) Often they try to balance one thing and horribly break other things in the process.

Thier net code is poor so there are out-of sync issues making PvP wonky sometimes.

This is alpha; maybe they will fix things maybe they won't.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've only played for a couple of hours so far, but i can already say, that this game has a lot of potential. It has it's problems, don't get me wrong, but the core elements of the game are already fantastic.

In this game you have to practise your skills in order to level them up (i.e. you chop wood to raise your logging level, or you craft some tools to raise tinkering). You start with the basics and craft a working bench, but later, if your skill levels are high enough you will be able to build houses, walls, watchtowers and everything else you need for your little town/fortress.

The map is huge! And the best part about it: You actually have to explore more and more of it, because of the constant need of better material.

Fighting in this game can be quite a hassle, because of the weird camera angle and somewhat random hitboxes, but i think it's manageable. There are quite a few different kind of weapons to choose from, and you level your weapon skill by using the weapon of your choice.

As stated above, you get better at skills by using them, but they also give you statpoints, based on how high your current skilllevel is. So in the long run your character gets stronger and stronger just like in other MMORPGs.

Tree of Life also features some sort of morality system, where you get flagged as a criminal for doing naughty things like murdering and stealing. The more people you kill, the longer you get to be a criminal, and as a criminal you lose everything upon death. I do hope, that they tweak this system a bit, because defending yourself against a non-criminal nets you some sweet criminal time, if you manage to kill your attacker.


TL:DR: It's a solid Early Access game with minor and fixable flaws and if you have some friends, who like these kind of games, i recommend you to get a 4-pack and start having some fun.

Edit:
Since the new patch as of today (18.06.2015) i can't recommend the game anymore.
The changes made to gear durability and the crime system are really really ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.

Imagine having someone knocking on your guildhall, a much more experienced player wandering the map seeking shelter for the night. We fed him and he traded us some mithril ore (which we had not seen before). He didn't have to, he just did. He told us tales of great guilds north of us, terrifying monsters, and adventures he had been on to get his gear.

It was something I have never experienced in a game before. The game itself is what you make of it. Go make your own RPG experience a reality.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tree of Life is a survival MMO. You can pvp, but it is discouraged as harming another player or their structure turns your name red for all players to see and you can be attacked by defensive towers. You also lose xp and items when you die. This game is enjoyed more with friends or a guild than solo. You can level up a ton of different skills, but you can't max everything so you must focus on certain ones. Exploring is quite fun, and it's cool to find massive cities that other players have built.

Pros:
+Never feels grindy
+Plenty of skills
+Plenty of buildings
+Good community
+Guilds
+Exploration

Cons:
+Map is not accurate.
+Some translations to English are bad and confusing
+Pvp is discouraged

Great indie game.


Extremely addicting, high amount of potential for shenanigans. This game really, really, reminds me of oldschool original UO. You may see people on the forums complaining of griefers or other issues with the community, but being a sandbox game, they need to realize its up to them to police the stuff. Cool building system, and attentive devs even with the smaell team.

The game does have some issues which it needs to work out, but I got 30 hours out of it in my first two days. If I stopped now thats less than 1 buck an hour of HIGHLY entertaining fun. (and I am guessing I will get hundreds of hours out of this game)

Buy it, play it, and do WHATEVER you want!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a huge amount of potential, and I really look forward to seeing the further development of the game.

After a few hours of relitively solo playing, I stumbled across a group who quickly take me in, help better equip me and then we built a large settlement, before I knew it I had spent half a day playing.
The main staple to the game is it's community, and rightfully so. It brings the true meaning to MMO where cooperation is pretty much essential for the enjoyment of the game.

The crafting system is relitively simple, however requires commitment to a few trades rather than trying to master all the crafting options. This helps to further promote working together.

Once I have experienced more of the game, and witnessed the further growth of the game I will update this review.

Overall worth trying for all MMO lovers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game reaches far beyond my expectations. For an early access, it runs quite smooth. Sure, there are bugs, but that's what early access is all about. Finding bugs for the developers to fix.

Gameplay:The gameplay runs smoothly. I've also enabled v-sync, so my fps stays a steady 60 fps to prevent screen tearing.
The dragging of items through the inventories feels a bit weird to me. This is not a big deal but might need some improvement. Im sure they will polish this and other features when the core mechanics are in place.

Community:The community is really nice. I've been killed 0 times by players till this time (3.5 hrs playtime). I've been in one fight however. But that was at the very beginning of the game. I spawned and someone tought i'd be an easy kill. I did kill him, however, I got a red name for murder. This made me drop my items upon dead. So the only thing I have to say about the community: Great! Which is pretty rare with a game like this. Normally I worry about loosing my stuff. But for as long as you don't kill others, you won't loose your own stuff either. That's probably the reason why the community is so friendly. They've implented this and works very well. I've got to give them that.

Development teamThey are really active with their community. When there is a restart, they will let people know in-game. Which is good ofcourse. Also, they fix bugs very quickly. There was one bug that made enemies invisible. Because of this, you couln't see then nor attack them. Guess what? The next day, they released a patch to fix both the invisible enemies. Also, they left a small explanation of why this happened which shows how much they care about their community.

Bugs & ErrorsSomething I noticed, were the spelling errors. While not big a deal, they might wanna fix this later on. Im not that great at english myself too, so I don't really mind.

Graphically, it all looks a bit empty. The world is really empty. You see a lot of trees and sometimes flowers, food etc. But when you are on the plains, it's just a flat world with some grass. But I'm sure they will add detail later since this isn't really a MUST for an early access game. It's all about fixing bugs right?

While i'm at it:
There is a weird bug where the world starts to flash. It's kind of annoying. Im not sure if im the only one but if i Alt+tab and go back to the game, it seems to fix it. Now, this might has something to do with my crossfire setup. Gonna find out soon.

Scores: Since this isn't a finished game yet, I will not look at the bugs. Simply because they aren't game breaking.
Gameplay: 8/10 - Combat is a bit too fast paced. Other than that, it plays smoothly.
Graphics: 7/10 - Looks nice in it's own way but is not detailed enough.
Community: 8/10 - Really friendly community. Finally a pvp game where KOS isn't a problem.
Development team: 9/10 - Very close with their community. Also fixes problems in a day or less. Listens to the community.
Bugs & errors: 11/10 - Do what they are supposed to do, obviously.

If you are looking at this game, and you aren't sure if you should buy it or not. I'd say you should. What can you loose other than your money?... Wait... No but seriously. Stop doubting and buy the game. You won't regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game will consume a whole afternoon and night, because there's just so much you can do to improve your character's skills and your base, along with exploration and the discovery of the game's core mechanics. Now, combine that with friends and the fun is multiplied.

It is really fun and has a quite interesting concept, but there is one undeniable truth that must not be overlooked: it is an early access game. However, by this I don't mean it's buggy (we actually had a bug-free long session of play), what I do mean is that it's still terribly unbalanced in the whole PVP/Crime system. In brief, if you pretend to play as a responsable, moral player, it's gonna be great while you're actually in-game (since people are pretty nice and conversative), but the second you stop playing, there is a 90% chance the next time you log in, you will find your nice, little settlement burned, destroyed and viciously raided. And there is nothing you can do to prevent this; you can protect your base against monsters (which is kind of weak, since the auto-turrets" do so little damage and cost so much)
date: but not against players. Players can destroy everything you built and nothing happens to them.\n\nThe system punishes your "crimes"
recommended: which are killing players who are not red and lockpicking other player's stashes. The punishment is making you a red player (red players drop everything when killed). But what happens to destroying another players property or trespassing? Stealing crops and killing my livestock animals is not considered a crime
hoursPlayed: so everyone can do it the second my crops and animals enter their vision. If you try to defend your stuff against a non-red player
voteText: and eventually kill him
helpfulPercent: you will turn red. They know this and use them to their advantage; you can't kill them
votesHelpful: all you can do is watch as they raid your little village and type stuff
votesTotal: unless you really want to kill them and turn red. If you decide to kill them and turn red
votesFunny: they will spawn back and kill you
commentsCount: taking all the stuff you are carrying
column16: and they won't turn red because they are killing a "criminal".\n\nThis is the only thing that truly prevents me from reviewing this game as positive
column17: since I find this is a joy-killing broken feature. I do not mind a PVP world
column18: as long as I can actually do something to protect what's mine.\n\nI do hope developers come out with some way to balance this broken system so I can go back and enjoy this evolving world. Only then I will change this review."
column19: June 3, 2015

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game reaches far beyond my expectations. For an early access, it runs quite smooth. Sure, there are bugs, but that's what early access is all about. Finding bugs for the developers to fix.

Gameplay:The gameplay runs smoothly. I've also enabled v-sync, so my fps stays a steady 60 fps to prevent screen tearing.
The dragging of items through the inventories feels a bit weird to me. This is not a big deal but might need some improvement. Im sure they will polish this and other features when the core mechanics are in place.

Community:The community is really nice. I've been killed 0 times by players till this time (3.5 hrs playtime). I've been in one fight however. But that was at the very beginning of the game. I spawned and someone tought i'd be an easy kill. I did kill him, however, I got a red name for murder. This made me drop my items upon dead. So the only thing I have to say about the community: Great! Which is pretty rare with a game like this. Normally I worry about loosing my stuff. But for as long as you don't kill others, you won't loose your own stuff either. That's probably the reason why the community is so friendly. They've implented this and works very well. I've got to give them that.

Development teamThey are really active with their community. When there is a restart, they will let people know in-game. Which is good ofcourse. Also, they fix bugs very quickly. There was one bug that made enemies invisible. Because of this, you couln't see then nor attack them. Guess what? The next day, they released a patch to fix both the invisible enemies. Also, they left a small explanation of why this happened which shows how much they care about their community.

Bugs & ErrorsSomething I noticed, were the spelling errors. While not big a deal, they might wanna fix this later on. Im not that great at english myself too, so I don't really mind.

Graphically, it all looks a bit empty. The world is really empty. You see a lot of trees and sometimes flowers, food etc. But when you are on the plains, it's just a flat world with some grass. But I'm sure they will add detail later since this isn't really a MUST for an early access game. It's all about fixing bugs right?

While i'm at it:
There is a weird bug where the world starts to flash. It's kind of annoying. Im not sure if im the only one but if i Alt+tab and go back to the game, it seems to fix it. Now, this might has something to do with my crossfire setup. Gonna find out soon.

Scores: Since this isn't a finished game yet, I will not look at the bugs. Simply because they aren't game breaking.
Gameplay: 8/10 - Combat is a bit too fast paced. Other than that, it plays smoothly.
Graphics: 7/10 - Looks nice in it's own way but is not detailed enough.
Community: 8/10 - Really friendly community. Finally a pvp game where KOS isn't a problem.
Development team: 9/10 - Very close with their community. Also fixes problems in a day or less. Listens to the community.
Bugs & errors: 11/10 - Do what they are supposed to do, obviously.

If you are looking at this game, and you aren't sure if you should buy it or not. I'd say you should. What can you loose other than your money?... Wait... No but seriously. Stop doubting and buy the game. You won't regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATED REVIEW 01/05/16

OVER 170 HOURS GAME PLAY

After the BETA update I decided to also update my review for the game there are some changes.

Tree of Life interesting survival game which has great potential but whether or not the developers communicate or not is a different matter. Currently in beta so it has many bugs and various issues but also some MAJOR issues which I will get in to.

In Tree of Life's current state there is much to improve on but there is still a lot of content there for everyone to enjoy so if you do wish to play Tree of Life in its beta state then please remember it is not the full game but you will have a good time depending on your neighbours.

Game play:

Tree of Life contains 25 skills that you can progress in which you can max only 8 so if you wish to become a fighter or builder then you can do so and ignore the skills you do not wish to progress in. However, there are some skills which you may not wish to progress in but you will be forced to level in e.g. If you want to create a weapon but that weapon requires an item that only a Tinkerer can create.

PvE:
There is a small amount of PvE but I think they are starting to focus on more of this. The basics are there but it is VERY basic. They have some plans" in the making apparently
date:
such as dungeons. But this has not been revealed exactly so who knows what they will be adding.

PvP:
There is much PvP which can be good or bad. PvP is extremely unbalanced as you can grief players by building all around their base and nothing can be done about it. The game punishes you If you try to prevent a griefer by turning you hostile rather than the griefer.

Grind:
This game is one of the biggest grinds I have seen in any game! The map is 4x bigger but you may have to travel for about 30mins to reach a special type of tree but as you reach your destination
recommended:
there are none around as it has been farmed. You will be running back and forth for hours on end.

Wood Cutting Simulator:
Because there is a huge grind and that most items need wood
hoursPlayed:
you will be cutting trees all day everyday! It is painfully slow and boring to cut wood and sometimes you may not even get any wood from a tree. I dint mind a small grind but the woodcutting is ridiculous!

In-Game Shop:
There is a shop where you can spend real money of items. This is fine and so far they are just bags with more slots and a mount. The only problem is the price. The prices for these items are extremely expensive. A mount costs ¬£15.41 and the game costs ¬£14.99!! Not only that but that mount is apparently 10% off!

Some Concerns:
I have around 100 hours into this game so far
voteText: made lots of friends (and enemies) and found a very friendly and active guild where we have spent a very long time improving our base and skills. I am having lots of fun but do get very frustrated with what has been updated in the game.\n\nNow we have had a map wipe on 18/04/16 which is perfectly fine as it let us start from scratch
helpfulPercent: we were told the map would be 4x bigger (woohoo!)
votesHelpful:
better graphics and more items etc have been added. Fantastic right? Wrong! 4x bigger is correct but they have hidden over half of the map! Covered it with thick fog not allowing us to see a thing and not allowing us to build in these areas! We were not told this before the map wipe so we had to suffer in silence.

Communication seems to be the biggest concern for me. There is some on the forum but if you dont sign up there then you will not be able to get as many updates. I know this is the beta but i feel like we have all been taken for a ride than we never wanted.

Pros:
Great graphics (it's not everyones cup of tea).
Many skills to choose from and level.
Huge map.
PVP/PVE (You don't have to PVP but prepare for it).
Criminal System (Not developed very well).
Bounty System (Not developed very well).
Friendly developers (When they actually communicate).
Feels different from other survival/sandbox games.
Monster villages which will attack player bases.
Just the right amount of challenge.

Cons:
Punishment for friendly players
Thick fog not allowing players to see/build half of the map.
Communication is very poor.
Bugs (It is Beta!).
Very little player customisation.
If your base is close to a raiding guild then prepare to log in every day to a raided base.
No fast travel on such a large map.
Real money in game shop is very expensive! For a bag it costs nearly as much as the actual game!

VERDICT:
DO NOT BUY IN CURRENT STATE!
In the games current state I would say wait a few more months. I hope they listen to our concerns because this game is not even in a beta stage in my opinion. They labeled it beta to get a flood of new customers and the game needs a hell of a lot more added to it. The only thing that keeps me playing Tree of Life is my guild members. We have put so much time into it that we do not want to put it to waste."

Early Access Review

It's a really cute game, nice for relaxing. Although it gets a little bit boring if you don't find company.
Also, for me it was a little bit uncomfortable to leave my stuff in huts, and if I don't show up whithin a day, something with happen with them (even when I use locks). And, there is so many unfinished buildings, started guilds without players! It would be great if guild hall would be hard to build, maybe more people get in the same party this way, which is good if you're playing with an mmorpg.

I recommend it because in the other side I had fun with it and will probably play more. It's really relaxing and sometimes you get excited by finding new stuff for building, crafting etc.
And yes, this is an early access, I'm sure it will be more interesting in the end as the developers listen to the reviews.

The Bad:

There are many issues with the game's criminal system
column17: what I call a Karma system
column18: after many games with an open PK system with a punishment. Criminal acts give the player a red name tag and a criminal debuff that runs on a timer based on the act(s) commited and how many times they were commited. During this time players will drop all of their loot on the ground upon being killed by the environment or other players.  The problem lies in that there are ways to work around getting flagged by committing crimes that are flagable by simply only doing up to 3 hits within a 10 second period then back off for a bit and come back to do some more damage.  This has led to a major abuse by many troll-like players in the community and has already pushed a good number of players out within the week the game h as been out.\n\nJust like any game in development

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is great with fun survival, and grind type aspects. Also the art style for this game is very good. The only problem I have with this game is it is terribly optimized.

I have a 970 and I can run GTA 5 on high 60 fps. Yet, I can't even run this game with all the lowest settings without 40-50 fps. Sadly it's just too laggy, I am constantly stuttering in game with low fps and I have found a lot of discussions about a fix for this problem. The thing is there is no fix. Many, many people are having this problem. I would suggest you buy this game if it looks good to you, but if you're stuttering and getting low fps. You either have to wait until they make this game playable, or refund it.

Out of the discussions I have seen about low fps on this game. People with 970's, 980's, 270x's, 280x's are having this problem. I haven't seen many people say they get low fps with a graphics card that is worse than any of those graphics cards. (If anyone know how to fix this I will remove my review and give it a positive review).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATED REVIEW 01/05/16

OVER 170 HOURS GAME PLAY

After the BETA update I decided to also update my review for the game there are some changes.

Tree of Life interesting survival game which has great potential but whether or not the developers communicate or not is a different matter. Currently in beta so it has many bugs and various issues but also some MAJOR issues which I will get in to.

In Tree of Life's current state there is much to improve on but there is still a lot of content there for everyone to enjoy so if you do wish to play Tree of Life in its beta state then please remember it is not the full game but you will have a good time depending on your neighbours.

Game play:

Tree of Life contains 25 skills that you can progress in which you can max only 8 so if you wish to become a fighter or builder then you can do so and ignore the skills you do not wish to progress in. However, there are some skills which you may not wish to progress in but you will be forced to level in e.g. If you want to create a weapon but that weapon requires an item that only a Tinkerer can create.

PvE:
There is a small amount of PvE but I think they are starting to focus on more of this. The basics are there but it is VERY basic. They have some plans" in the making apparently
date:
such as dungeons. But this has not been revealed exactly so who knows what they will be adding.

PvP:
There is much PvP which can be good or bad. PvP is extremely unbalanced as you can grief players by building all around their base and nothing can be done about it. The game punishes you If you try to prevent a griefer by turning you hostile rather than the griefer.

Grind:
This game is one of the biggest grinds I have seen in any game! The map is 4x bigger but you may have to travel for about 30mins to reach a special type of tree but as you reach your destination
recommended:
there are none around as it has been farmed. You will be running back and forth for hours on end.

Wood Cutting Simulator:
Because there is a huge grind and that most items need wood
hoursPlayed:
you will be cutting trees all day everyday! It is painfully slow and boring to cut wood and sometimes you may not even get any wood from a tree. I dint mind a small grind but the woodcutting is ridiculous!

In-Game Shop:
There is a shop where you can spend real money of items. This is fine and so far they are just bags with more slots and a mount. The only problem is the price. The prices for these items are extremely expensive. A mount costs ¬£15.41 and the game costs ¬£14.99!! Not only that but that mount is apparently 10% off!

Some Concerns:
I have around 100 hours into this game so far
voteText: made lots of friends (and enemies) and found a very friendly and active guild where we have spent a very long time improving our base and skills. I am having lots of fun but do get very frustrated with what has been updated in the game.\n\nNow we have had a map wipe on 18/04/16 which is perfectly fine as it let us start from scratch
helpfulPercent: we were told the map would be 4x bigger (woohoo!)
votesHelpful:
better graphics and more items etc have been added. Fantastic right? Wrong! 4x bigger is correct but they have hidden over half of the map! Covered it with thick fog not allowing us to see a thing and not allowing us to build in these areas! We were not told this before the map wipe so we had to suffer in silence.

Communication seems to be the biggest concern for me. There is some on the forum but if you dont sign up there then you will not be able to get as many updates. I know this is the beta but i feel like we have all been taken for a ride than we never wanted.

Pros:
Great graphics (it's not everyones cup of tea).
Many skills to choose from and level.
Huge map.
PVP/PVE (You don't have to PVP but prepare for it).
Criminal System (Not developed very well).
Bounty System (Not developed very well).
Friendly developers (When they actually communicate).
Feels different from other survival/sandbox games.
Monster villages which will attack player bases.
Just the right amount of challenge.

Cons:
Punishment for friendly players
Thick fog not allowing players to see/build half of the map.
Communication is very poor.
Bugs (It is Beta!).
Very little player customisation.
If your base is close to a raiding guild then prepare to log in every day to a raided base.
No fast travel on such a large map.
Real money in game shop is very expensive! For a bag it costs nearly as much as the actual game!

VERDICT:
DO NOT BUY IN CURRENT STATE!
In the games current state I would say wait a few more months. I hope they listen to our concerns because this game is not even in a beta stage in my opinion. They labeled it beta to get a flood of new customers and the game needs a hell of a lot more added to it. The only thing that keeps me playing Tree of Life is my guild members. We have put so much time into it that we do not want to put it to waste."

I'll Admit I didnt play very far but 3 things struck me right away.

1. The place is a trailerpark of unfinished starting bases everywhere
2. The world is desolate - I saw 3 people in the span of a weekend and we covered alot of ground. 2 of the three people asked us to join thier large guild. Our small group didn't want to do that right away because I felt like it would cheapen the game getting things handed to us or being forced to work for the mats to give to the guild.

I was excited to get into this game and it looked great... another cool idea, just doesn't seem to hang on to the people.

In its current state - I don't think I can recommend this.

Early Access Review

Do not buy this game.  It‚Äôs a cartoony version of eve online.  The only reason why there are so many positive reviews is because the game developers bribed the players with free DLC packs if they wrote one for them.

I have now played this game for 2 days now.  In that time people have spawn camp killed me relentlessly, smashed up all my stuff, chased me down and stolen all my supplies.  I was even threatened by some jerk that they would endlessly harass me unless I paid them to stop.

I reported these people to the game developers and they don‚Äôt seem to care that people are griefing and harassing new players.  I barely had the basic crafting system down before I was being bombarded by people who have nothing better to do then to kill other players.  It was said in the forums that if you don‚Äôt like getting killed then join a guild or gain levels and kill them back. So I joined a guild it was a small group and while they were offline SLEEPING and I was in my base crafting stuff I continuously got raided by griefers who would kill my animals, steal my crops and smash up all my buildings.  As I am attempting to get away from these people and not die from the monster NPC‚Äôs who are wearing armor while I‚Äôm wearing nothing but starter clothes I still tried to level up my skills to get stronger to defend myself.  But in this game if you don‚Äôt constantly eat some kind of food you die very quickly.  I couldn't even gather enough supplies to not starve. They killed me so much and harassed me so frequently I wasn‚Äôt able to level very quickly, thus prolonging the frustrating endless harassment.

This game was a complete waste of my money and I regret ever hearing about it.

So if you love to spend you‚Äôre waking existence bringing others down and making them miserable until they no longer want to play the game then this is a great game for you.  For everyone else who just wants to have fun just know that I warned you.  If you buy the game anyway and became enraged by the countless hours lost to jerks who want nothing more than to make you suffer just remember that I did warn you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I posted a pre-game review to get the 8-slot DLC backpack, which I guess was worth it, but since I had no game experience then, I scrapped it and decided to rewrite it. Anyways...

Tree of Life is kind of fun, in the same way that Rust or other sociopathic sandboxes are. The major problem is the shortage of land between the three servers (America, EU, and Asia). Most if not all good land is taken. If you find a spot, it is probably for good reason: monster spawns that will destroy your stuff; it's near a raiding guild; the invisible grid for structure placement is awkward (such as in tight valleys or tops of mountains).

While the map is huge, I kid you not, you can't go anywhere without seeing a giant walled fortress or someone's abandoned settlement (most likely because they played, logged off, and moved on to another game). With the travel time increasing the frustration of staking out your own claim, you will soon realize that this game is not what it's cracked up to be.

Crafting is not so bad, but the truth is that for each major skill specialization, there's a structure for that, probably a building. Okay, how big? 4x4 square area. When you start to realize that you need multiple buildings to advance, you quickly realize this is not meant to be a solo venture like Minecraft or Rust. Everything takes a LOT of room. I have seen entire fortresses belonging to one person. I would prefer crafting benches instead of buildings (because let's face it, you don't need an entire building to sew something together or cut some wood into lumber).

Other issues like red players (those that have killed other players, stolen, or griefed structures) are not your biggest problem unless they are raiding you. A lot will complain, but honestly I haven't encountered too many and was able to run from all of them. There reportedly is a hacker on the EU server, but only report so far.

PROS:
+ Fun to build your own fortress
+ Crafting recipes themselves aren't too bad
+ Mobs are pretty easy and food is super easy to find (punch trees for apples, cook them in a fire)
+ If you liked punching trees in Minecraft, you're gonna have a blast

CONS:
- There is not a lot of room to build considering the player count vs map size
- Many abandoned and/or raided settlements consume valuable real estate
- The crafting system relies heavily on large stationary structures
- Red players (as it stands as of the write of this review) can become a large problem if you live too close to them
- The graphics are sub-par and character models look like they were whipped up in a matter of minutes
- The day/night cycle is not well balanced (days and nights are about the same, feels like spring/fall equinox)

Rating (as of today): 5/10

TL;DR: If you are looking to get this game, just be forewarned: it is Early Access, so you can only expect so much. It has a lot of potential, but still has a long way to go before it can compete with other sandbox MMOs. As it stands, I can't recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You will see a lot of negative points talking about how their buildings were destroyed and how they were stole etc etc.
But thats their fault, not the game, it just means that their skill wasn't high level to place good locks (if they even had locks) or that their arrows weren't strong enough (stone arrows barely do a thing when you have armor).

Now talking about the game...
It is still in Early Access that means a lot of things will change, and from the updates the devs are releasing it will change in a good way!

In this game you have 3 major stats:
- Constitution, which increase your health;
- Dexterity, which increases the player ability to dodge and his stamina (Dodge isn't implemented yet);
- Strength, which you do with weapons.
There is also a fourth stat, Intelligence, that will determine's a player's magic ability, but that isn't implemented yet either.

You can increase this stats by training your skills that go from sword fighting to sewing, you have a lot of them and you will want to increase them all! But you can't, you have a point limit which only allows you to max 8 skills.
What most new players do, and should do, is increase their carpenter and thinkering level, that will allow them to make new buildings, buildings which they will need to survive.

The point of the game isn't playing alone, otherwise it will be very hard to defend yourself against high lvl players.
This is a game made for teamplay, every skill that makes items (sewing, blacksmithing, cooking, etc) needs items from the other skills and, like I said before, there is no way to max them all so you will need to either make a village" with more players or buy the items you need from them.

The bad part of this game is that it is in fact in Early Access
date: when the game launched there was an insane amount of players and the dev's weren't expecting that amount of players so the map was too small for them all
recommended: since most of those players stopped playing waiting for the dev's to update the map you will see a lot of abandoned buildings lying around.\n\nLong story short

helpfulPercent: you kill animals and try to slaughter every single person you see... you might die x)\nIn this version of the game you can do "almost" anything you want.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've never felt so alone playing an online game.

So why are there so many positive reviews?
Because the developers gave permanent extra inventory slots and a hair style to the people who wrote a positive review.

The game is in Early Acces. With it comes the usual crappy client issues like unexplained fps drops, screen tearing, client crashes, but that's the least of your worries.

I really wanted to like the game, but I'm afraid it's very dull, featureless, boring, repetative, flawed and most importantly - time consuming.

Let's start with the major flaws:
There is no party chat or global chat or guild chat. Wait! There is no party in the game. The sole guild feature in the game is that you can use your guild members' buildings if they put a guild lock on it. So where are your friends in the world? Ask them on Skype or Teamspeak, cuz there is no other way to find out. So for an online game, it's amazing how antisocial this game is, and how hard it is to play with others. And make no mistake. This is NOT a game you can solo, unless you play like 70 hours for the first 4-5 days, and at least 3 hours every day after that.

Night and day follow each other in quick succession. Night time is so dark, that you literally can't see anything. I'm not joking. It's pitch black. Seriously. Black. This means that you either spend LOTS of resources on lightning (which is very dumb) or you limit yourself to tasks that don't require moving or seeing (standing 10 minutes crafting, harvesting lumber or stone). If you try to do anything else then you'll be GREATLY penalized.

Traveling is superslow, superboring, superblehI'lljustaltf4.
But you'll need to travel, because certain resources like lava sculpture" (red ore) or corn or whatever is not found in your home biome. Let me translate:
You want to get lava? Push WWWWW for 10 minutes. Look at a completely black screen (night) for 10 minutes. Do some mining
date: then head back and push the same boring WWWWW for 20 minutes
recommended: and stare at a completely black screen for 10 minutes. As there is no fast travel.\n\nIt took us about 80 manhours to build a base that can put up a small defense. Which means it has 1 of each type of buildings
hoursPlayed: 6 storage buildings
voteText: a wooden wall
helpfulPercent:
and about 14 mark2 towers.
80.
Hours.
Without a base you can't do anything
votesHelpful: cuz crafting is dependent on crafting buildings
votesTotal: and storage space
votesFunny: so no fort = no buildings = no anything.\nEach night (every 10 minutes) zombies and skeletons will spawn and chip away at your walls. It takes about 5-10 minutes for 1 of these creatures to chip away at your walls. A tower kills them in about 10-15 arrows. Our base has to fend off about 4 mobs each night. So 15arrowpermob * 4mobpernight * 72 nights a day means you'll need about 4300 arrows a day. Those will have to be crafted by a carpenter. Someone will have to collect those mats. 20 arrow = 1 copper 1 lumber 1 feather. So you'll have to craft this recipe about 200 times a day. Just crafting all that ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• requires you to sit at the crafting bench for 20 minutes

column18: and it will take about 10 minutes of beating up kobolds and skeletons and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to have enough to fix your buildings.\n\nSo all in all
column19: your completely minimalistic base spends about 3 hours a day just to defend itself from monsters at night with a high success rate.\nAnd that's only if RNGesus didn't spawn the monsters in an uneven way.\nAnd that's only if players didn't grief you. We were griefed every few hours. And you will be too! We went for a 20 minute break on the first day. Base got destroyed. We went to sleep on the first day. Half the base was destroyed. We went to sleep on the 2nd day. All our buildings were lockpicked. The arrows were stolen from our towers
column20: so much of what the players didn't take or destroy was destroyed by monsters entering the disarmed base.\nBut the best thing is:\nIf you don't repair the base each day. Don't restock your arrows every 24 hours then your base will be leveled in 1 day
column21:
and you'll lose the time put into your lost items and buildings.

Let me rephrase that:
THERE IS NO POINT IN PLAYING THIS GAME
column22:
UNLESS YOU ARE WILLING TO SPEND AT LEAST THREE HOURS A DAY ON JUST FORT MAINTENANCE.

And even if you do. Some player might just decide to destroy your whole base for fun. He can do that naked with his fists if he wants to.

But why would you want to play this game? It has virtually nothing to offer besides building a base and crafting.

Combat is really annoying and boring. Targeting is hard. You'll often end up hitting your buddy instead of the monster you are trying to hit. Trying to hit moving enemy players is hard

PvP is pretty much nonexistent except for griefing. You know why? Cuz it's boring

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So i really did enjoy playing this game. Well that is until the trolls and griefers came around. I was even willing to forgive the crazyt fast day/night cycle and the pitch black nights(cant see anything). They need more servers. The american server is wayyyyyy overpopulated. This overpopulation means loads of trolls. Had 2 guys needlessly grief me. They filled up my entire base with unbuilt walls and destroyed all of my buildings. Thing is there is absolutely no way to combat this either.

Walls do not actually keep anyone out of your base. The walls are essentially pointless. While you can build defenses, for example, an arrow tower it takes so many arrows to keep it going and you have to supply them. They also will only shoot red characters and mobs. There are so many mobs at night that your arrows disappear in minutes.

I did enjoy all the different biomes and i loved the animals. Only thing about animals is you cannot claim any as your own really. You are supposed to be able to breed them but that will never happen cause someone will kill them before you could even attempt to do it.

Mostly the game was just ruined for me by the griefers and trolls. They need to implement some sort of system where you can claim land or build walls that can actually keep people out. If you buy this game do not get attached to anything you build or any resources you gather cause they will get stolen or destroyed.

I will change my review if they actually implement more servers and a way to combat griefers and trolls because i thuroughly enjoyed the game itself.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It‚Äôs been years since I‚Äôve enjoyed a game this much! I don‚Äôt see myself getting bored any time soon. It‚Äôs like the Harvest Moon online that I always dreamed of. Between farming, fishing, building, lockpicking, crafting, levelling, always being in need of resources, and always needing to find food to eat, I find my attention pulled constantly in different directions, and always having 10 things on my list that I need to get done as I build my base and level my character. To me, that‚Äôs the mark of a well-thought out game. Plus the stealing, plundering, and pvp elements of the game add an element of danger that motivates you to keep on fortifying those walls and securing your base.

With the latest patch, many pvp‚Äôers are complaining that the game punishes them too severely (by instituting skill loss depending on your criminal level), but I personally think the developers have done a nice job of allowing pvp and theft while yet keeping the game from being an endless griefer fest.

If you‚Äôre looking for a hardcore pvp game, this probably isn‚Äôt it (just look at the visuals!). This is more of a grindy survival sandbox. I‚Äôd compare it to the old Runescape, but without quests and with more survival elements. Some people have said the game is not solo friendly, but I have been playing solo and am doing just fine so far. Love it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having played this game now for 50 hours I feel I am allowed to make a proper review~
First of all I would like to point out that this game IS still in early access, so any problems shall be Assumed to be fixed later :)
Even in the early stages, this game..Is amazing, my friends and I have been addicted since it's release, working together in a big community over a voice chat program like RaidCall, helping eachother out, building our base and making it stronger, going on adventures. It's truly a good game already, but is quite buggy at times and a couple things need to be over-worked. First and fore-most the Criminal System needs a huge overhaul, the Devs just released a statement saying they will be looking for ways to fix this, as well as making your base more defensable when you are logged out so if you cant play for two days you wont come back to complete rubble. Combat I think needs a tune-up as well, it's all fine and well for PvE combat currently, but the PvP is a little bit silly with the targeting being so shotty. But if you play the game just for what it is, it Is actually very very good, just give it a try (especially if you have friends) and you will soon see why it's worth your money. I do understand that certain areas and regions have grifers and a lot of people are mad, my advice is just be patient, if the area you are in is far too hostile, Move!.. If you can't handle the heat, get out of the kitchen you know?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are in to hours of non-stop foraging for items only to end up trapped in a hole in the ground somewhere on a map with no route of escape, then this game is for you.
Maybe you enjoy running for two hours on a map to find your friend's base only to find out you need the guild master who isn't online to join the team.
This game is not for the mediocre or casual gamer. If you plan on wasting hours of your time getting mauled to death by invisible creatures in a fog filled swamp, you are at the right place.
I am certain there might be a point in the game in which gameplay is actually fun, but I have had more entertainment while standing in line at the DMV to get my licence tags.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is decent but still needs a heck of a lot of work.

At the moment I only recommend it if you don't mind issues occuring on occasion like dying out of nowhere, lagspikes, random crashes, graphical errors, and such mainly.

If you can look beyond that and continue playing it then you will find it quite enjoyable. It is definitely pretty boring playing by yourself though so I definitely recommend looking for a guild or partner to play it with if you can as this game is definitely built around teamwork for sure!

Aside from that I wish the houses were better and that you could go inside of them but you can't. Everything is only accessible from the outside which is a bit of a disappointment. Also the crafting isn't as straight forward because its a bit different than other games so it will take you a little bit of time to fully get used to doing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is like League of legends or dota 2

and not like  Minecraft , h1z1 , Reign of Kings, and rust.

In tree of life its kind of like if you are online you are fine, most people will not mess with you some times they do, but no big deal. right when you log off ,and night hits, npcs will blow up 85% of your stuff, the rest of the stuff players will pick lock open your buildings (chest) and just steal stuff or leave it open so they lvl up the pick locking skill.  Its like a round game, where you build and make stuff when you are online, but rightttt when you log off every thing will be blown up or missing. Un-like games like minecraft or h1z1 where you can build a base and be fine when you log back in the next day.

I would say only get this game if you have about 5-6 friends who will be active with you and all do a set job, then maybe you can have a base up before you guys log off( if you guys stay on for 8 hours). Me? I only had 2 more friends, 2 nights with 2 diffrent bases they get wiped out, the best thing is to log off with every thing you have. Even the people who do make it and have the citys made, seem to get bored after they get every thing set and it seems like there is more abandoned house then in new york. they just let the base go and npcs/ reds just raid them when they are off line, The only way you can keep npcs/reds off your walls is if you have many many arrow towers all over your base, and you have to supply it with ammo thats very hard to get the mats for it.

Its getting very good reviews and im fine with games like LoL and Dota, but not when it comes to survival/building/mmo type games.

So if you want to play a survival game that every time you log on, you will have to re build everthing! this is your game!!!

Early Access Review

This game is great for early acces, only hope the devs don't make too much of of it and decide it's not worth it.

Certain nuisances to expect----lag, someehat jittery combat (easily avoidable if you just hold left click once you get a target, lack of online information about certain subjects.

Community on this game is great, has a built in pk system/violence system, promotes teamwork and alliances against the evil forces of the dark.

Getting started is very, very difficult yet fun.

So far, 7.5/10, will update as the game gets better, and if it actually gets released" unlike most early acces games."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Most people have mentioned the griefing and pvping that happens in this game.. ive noticed also that they have only put in between 2-10 hours.. Ill put this out there so everyone has a clear understanding that you gain next to nothing by PvPing.. yet lose everything. if someone attacks and kills you, you will drop one random item from your bag.. then if you kill them (as they would now be red) they will not only drop your random stack of twigs but also their armour, weapons, food and whatever else they had. Due to this the only time you see people attacking other people is in the rookie starting locations as people dont know what to do, attack eachother and then complain about the game being pvp..

The game is 99% focused PvE with great communities forming all accross the map. if a single one of these negative commenters took a walk accross the vast and plentifull biomes they would see huge thriving kingdoms and economies. They would encounter players travelling to sell their ore in other areas, in which it lacks, for profit. They would see that it is neer impossible to actually attack another player without dieing from the other arrow towers nearby.

This game is absolutely huge and it is only early access. I have currently played over 40 hours in this game and i am still yet to get even close to the crafting peak. i have built my own fort and armed it with defence, yet i still have noob gear as i wanted to focus in crafting.. this shows that you dont need epic gear to win. you dont need a huge guild backing.. you simply need to think of what you want to do and do it.

as for the others still in the rookie area attacking one another.. good luck with that,

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am reommending this game...but it def needs some tweaking.

Pros:

As a gather, build, survival game...it is the best I've seen. What you can build and how you go about building is enjoyable.

I personally love the Engrish descriptions of items.

Adventuring around and exploring this land is fun.

Cons:

Hours of hard work can be wiped away incredibly fast by undead attacks or by other players.

Night and day alternate way too quickly. I would love to see a shorter night and longer day.

Ownership of an item (wall piece, arrow tower, building) should be done when item is crafted. I had a few buildings packaged up and ready to beploy....when this jackass came into my base and started unpackaging them. They then showed as her buildings.

Decrease level of damage the undead do or increase the damage arrow towers do.
